alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Douglas; Franklin (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 5:28PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Franklin, northeastern Anderson and southeastern Douglas Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 528 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Baldwin City to near Rantoul to 5 miles southeast of Parker. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ottawa, Baldwin City, Wellsville, Greeley, Princeton, Lane and Rantoul. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 183 and 198. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
